item.title: Melanie add a quote by Kate Atkinson
item.description: "Why do cats sleep so much? Perhaps they've been trusted with some major cosmic task, an essential law of physics - such as: if there are less than 5 million cats sleeping at any one time the world will stop spinning. So that when you look at them and think, "what a lazy, good-for-nothing animal," they are, in fact, working very, very hard." -- Kate Atkinson

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "No one can make you feel inferior without your consent." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "You live and learn. At any rate, you live." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Billy Sunday
item.description: "Going to church doesnâ€™t make you a Christian any more than going to a garage makes you an automobile." -- Billy Sunday

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "Fate is like a strange, unpopular restaurant filled with odd little waiters who bring you things you never asked for and don't always like." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Christopher Moore
item.description: "The problem with being nuts, she thought, is that you don't always feel as if you're nuts. Sometimes, in fact, you feel perfectly sane, and there just happens to be a trailer-shaped dragon crouching in the lot next door." -- Christopher Moore

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Maureen Johnson
item.description: "Claim whatever you want. Say you only want a happy family or a successful career or a big house. I say: no, that's not what you want. You'll settle for those things, but you really want a monkey that does your evil bidding. Pullman is a genius just for this." -- Maureen Johnson

item.title: Melanie add a quote by pablo neruda
item.description: "You are like nobody since I love you." -- pablo neruda

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Melanie add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Charles W. Eliot
item.description: "Books are the quietest and most constant of friends; they are the most accessible and wisest of counselors, and the most patient of teachers." -- Charles W. Eliot

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "I am so clever that sometimes I don't understand a single word of what I am saying." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Lucy Maud Montgomery
item.description: "It's been my experience that you can nearly always enjoy things if you make up your mind firmly that you will." -- Lucy Maud Montgomery

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Gail Carson Levine
item.description: "A library is infinity under a roof." -- Gail Carson Levine

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Nicole Krauss
item.description: "Once upon a time there was a boy who loved a girl, and her laughter was a question he wanted to spend his whole life answering." -- Nicole Krauss

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Horace Mann
item.description: "A house without books is like a room without windows." -- Horace Mann

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "Sometimes I can hear my bones straining under the weight of all the lives I'm not living." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "We do know that no one gets wise enough to really understand the heart of another, though it is the task of our life to try." -- Louise Erdrich

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Berger
item.description: "When we read a story, we inhabit it. The covers of the book are like a roof and four walls. What is to happen next will take place within the four walls of the story. And this is possible because the story's voice makes everything its own." -- John Berger

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Richard Llewellyn
item.description: "O, there is lovely to feel a book, a good book, firm in the hand, for its fatness holds rich promise, and you are hot inside to think of good hours to come." -- Richard Llewellyn

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Edith Sitwell
item.description: "Winter is the time for comfort, for good food and warmth, for the touch of a friendly hand and for a talk beside the fire: it is the time for home." -- Edith Sitwell

item.title: Melanie add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: Melanie add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "I do things like get in a taxi and say, "The library, and step on it." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Lemony Snicket
item.description: "If you are allergic to a thing, it is best not to put that thing in your mouth, particularly if the thing is cats." -- Lemony Snicket

item.title: Melanie add a quote by John Burroughs
item.description: "Do not despise your own place and hour. Every place is under the stars, every place is the center of the world." -- John Burroughs

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Barbara Kingsolver
item.description: "The very least you can do in your life is figure out what you hope for. And the most you can do is live inside that hope. Not admire it from a distance but live right in it, under its roof." -- Barbara Kingsolver

item.title: Melanie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett
